BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1958 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3866, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of NYC correction dept. for ordinary disability benefits

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2519, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7243, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs members of the New York City employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, to deputy sheriffs members of NYCERS.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5437, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8245, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year/age fifty-five retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as a mortuary/quality assurance member subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a 25/55 retirement program for members of NYCERS employed as mortuary/quality assurance.

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1958 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3866, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of NYC correction dept. for ordinary disability benefits

Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the department of correction.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4081-A, and Assembly Member Perry, A.1445-A, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the “open driveway act” regarding the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sampson S.2158, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to reconvey its interest in certain real property, acquired through in rem tax foreclosure, in Brooklyn to Elva McZeal Tenants Association Develoment Fund Corp.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Gordon A.6463, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
